More From Adam Savage on the Tim Ferriss Podcast

351 words written on Sat, Sep 21 2019

Again, from Adam Savage on Great Tools, Great Projects, and Great Lessons, at about 1h12m:

When I finally got to Industrial Light & Magic in 1998, into their model shop on episodes one and two and Space Cowboys, I found an incredible group of peers and teachers and friends and there still was not a single build in the five years I spent in that model shop where I didn‚Äôt feel at some point someone was going to come up, tap me on the shoulder and tell me the relief pitcher‚Äôs coming out because I clearly have no idea what I‚Äôm doing and it‚Äôs time to go home.

And at a certain point at ILM I was like, ‚ÄúMan, I‚Äôm in Valhalla. I‚Äôm in the place where every model maker in the world wants to end up here and I am good enough to get here. Why do I still have so much judgment every time I screw something up?‚Äù Then I realize, ‚ÄúWell, that‚Äôs part of my process. It‚Äôs part of the process. Clearly it‚Äôs going to happen no matter how technically competent I get. So I‚Äôm just going to push past it.‚Äù And on Tested, that day that I finished feeling so crappy, I came in the next day. We filmed again for a day and I got the part right. Then I turned to the camera and I explained all of that‚Ä¶

We‚Äôre all flawed. To be honest, confronting that, confronting the limits of one‚Äôs ability to be perfect, that is tough‚Ä¶

It‚Äôs still very difficult for me to confront the fact that I‚Äôm a flawed human being. There‚Äôs still some part of me that thinks, ‚ÄúOh, as long as I perform all these things correctly, everything will go smoothly.‚Äù The answer is, no. That‚Äôs fiction.
